noun.name: stop sign
noun.discription: a traffic sign indicating that vehicles must stop at an intersection

object1.name: yield sign
object1.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating that vehicles must yield the right-of-way to other vehicles or pedestrians

object2.name: speed limit sign
object2.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating the maximum speed allowed on a particular road

object3.name: no parking sign
object3.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating that parking is prohibited in a specific area

object4.name: pedestrian crossing sign
object4.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating a designated area where pedestrians may cross the road

object5.name: one way sign
object5.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating that vehicles are allowed to travel in only one direction

object6.name: no entry sign
object6.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating that vehicles are prohibited from entering a particular area

object7.name: school zone sign
object7.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating a reduced speed limit in areas near schools

object8.name: road work sign
object8.discription: in parallel with 'stop sign', is a traffic sign indicating that road construction or maintenance is taking place ahead
